JavaFinAccount 1.0-SNAPSHOT API

Financial Accounting System

Project Description

The Financial Accounting System is designed to manage and analyze financial records. The application provides features such as:

  • Adding records: Users can enter details about expenses and income specifying the amount, category (e.g., food, entertainment, transportation), and date.
  • Viewing data: Users can review their financial records through a text user interface.
  • Statistics: The system generates graphical statistics of expenses and income, helping users visualize their financial health.
  • Data storage: Automatically saves information to a text file, allowing for data persistence between sessions.
  • Control: Operates through a console-based user interface where users navigate and interact via menu selections and data inputs.

Architecture and Class Structure

The application is structured using the onion architecture to ensure robust scalability and maintainability. This architecture centers the application's domain logic, surrounded by layers handling application services, infrastructure, and the user interface. Below is a breakdown of each layer and its components:

  1. Domain Layer:
    This is the core of the application, containing essential entities such as:
    • Record
    • Category
    • User
    • DateAndTime
    Value objects like StatisticField are used for specific data operations, primarily statistical computations.
  2. Application Services Layer:
    Acts as a mediator between the domain and infrastructure layers, with key services including:
    • RecordService
    • UserService
    • CategoryService
    • StatisticsService
    These services manage data flow and enforce business rules by delegating computations and operations to the domain layer. This structured approach ensures that operations are processed efficiently, aligning with the core business logic encapsulated in the domain.
  3. Infrastructure Layer:
    Implements interfaces defined by the core for data persistence and operations, comprising:
    • InMemoryRecordRepository
    • InMemoryCategoryRepository
    • InMemoryUserRepository
    This layer also includes serialization components like RecordSerializer for data integrity and conversion. It handles detailed interactions with data, particularly managing file-based data storage and in-memory data repositories.
  4. User Interface Layer:
    The top layer that interfaces directly with users through a Text User Interface (TUI). TUI uses controllers from the Controllers package enhancing user interaction with data managed at the infrastructure level and enabling access to application services for data processing.
Packages
Package
Description
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon
 
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.application
Provides the core application logic that connects the domain models with the user interfaces.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.application.config
Contains configuration class responsible for setting up services repositories.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.application.services
Contains service classes that define the application's business logic.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.application.utils
Provides utility classes that assist in the application logic layer, offering shared resources such as date handling, validation, and conversion utilities.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.domain
This package contains the domain layer of the application.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.domain.entities
Contains the core business entities of the financial accounting system.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.domain.exceptions
Defines exception classes that are specific to the domain layer, used to handle various business rule violations and other domain-specific errors.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.domain.repositories
Contains interfaces for repository patterns, providing abstract access to data storage mechanisms.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.domain.services
Presents domain services that contain business logic and computations.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.infrastructure
This package manages all infrastructure concerns of the application, including data storage, serialization, and other cross-cutting technical services.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.infrastructure.common
Provides common infrastructure functionality that supports using the container with services.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.infrastructure.exceptions
Defines exceptions specific to the infrastructure layer, dealing with errors in data access, serialization, and other low-level operations.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.infrastructure.files
Contains classes for file management, including file reading and writing operations.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.infrastructure.formatters
Includes classes that format data for storage or display, ensuring that data is presented and stored in a consistent format throughout the application.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.infrastructure.repositories
Provides concrete implementations of the data repository interfaces defined in the domain layer.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.infrastructure.serialization
Offers serialization and deserialization functionalities for converting objects to data formats suitable for storage and transmission, and vice versa.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.infrastructure.utils
Contains utility classes that support the infrastructure, including hashing, encoding, and other low-level data manipulation tasks.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.ui
This package is responsible for all user interface components.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.ui.controllers
Contains controller classes that manage user interactions, bridging the user interface with application services to process and respond to user input.
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.ui.tui
Provides classes for the Text User Interface (TUI) of the financial accounting system.
